arm_group.description: Study subjects will take 2,000 I.U. vitamin D daily for three months

brief_summary.textblock:
We will study whether taking vitamin D improves asthma control and spirometric values in
      elderly asthmatics.

clinical_study.brief_title: Asthma in the Elderly: The Role of Vitamin D

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Asthma, age of 65 years old or older

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current smokers, subjects who smoked more than 10 pack/year, subjects taking digoxin,
             subjects with liver disease

facility.name: Rohr and Columbo Asthma, Allergy and Immunology Specialists

clinical_study.official_title: Asthma in the Elderly: The Role of Vitamin D

other_outcome.measure: Serum vitamin D and calcium levels

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Asthma Control Test (ACT) score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rohr and Columbo Asthma, Allergy and Immunology Specialists, P.C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in pulmonary function tests values (FEV1%, etc.)

clinical_study.source: Rohr and Columbo Asthma, Allergy and Immunology Specialists, P.C.

lead_sponsor.agency: Rohr and Columbo Asthma, Allergy and Immunology Specialists, P.C.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
